intro: Solanum denticulatum var. gouakai, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a member of the Solanaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa, characterized by its small, spiny leaves and clusters of white or yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid conditions. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
